alert.note: Alert for Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:41AM EST until January 12 at 6:15AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN WARRICK...SPENCER...NORTHWESTERN DAVIESS AND EAST CENTRAL HENDERSON COUNTIES... At 440 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Stanley, or 11 miles northwest of Owensboro, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Owensboro and Eureka around 445 AM CST. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Rockport, Grandview and Santa Claus. This includes Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 15 and 21. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
